abstract: The Chinese aluminum company is in advanced discussions to reach a deal that could strengthen its grip on raw materials.
snippet: The Chinese aluminum company is in advanced discussions to reach a deal that could strengthen its grip on raw materials.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  The Aluminum Corporation of China is in advanced discussions with the mining company Rio Tinto about increasing its investment in Rio Tinto and acquiring some of its assets for about $20 billion to strengthen its grip on the supply of raw materials, two people close to the talks said Wednesday.

headline.main: China Is Said to Be Seeking Bigger Stake in Rio Tinto
headline.print_headline: China Is Said To Be Seeking Bigger Stake In Rio Tinto

abstract: The mining group Rio Tinto confirmed that Aluminum Corporation of China would invest $19.5 billion, which it hopes will help it pay down debt.
snippet: The mining group Rio Tinto confirmed that Aluminum Corporation of China would invest $19.5 billion, which it hopes will help it pay down debt.
lead_paragraph: LONDON  The Aluminum Corporation of China agreed on Thursday to invest $19.5 billion in the mining group Rio Tinto, taking advantage of lower valuations to guarantee access to iron ore resources. It was China’s largest purchase overseas.

headline.main: Chinalco to Invest $19.5 Billion in Rio Tinto
headline.print_headline: Chinalco to Invest $19.5 Billion in Rio Tinto

abstract: Rio Tinto confirmed on Thursday that Aluminum Corporation of China will invest $19.5 billion in the mining group, a move that it hopes will help it pay down debt but that is likely to set off opposition from politicians worried about the Chinese group’s influence in the company.
lead_paragraph: Rio Tinto confirmed on Thursday that Aluminum Corporation of China will invest $19.5 billion in the mining group, a move that it hopes will help it pay down debt but that is likely to set off opposition from politicians worried about the Chinese group’s influence in the company.

headline.main: Chinalco to Invest $19.5 Billion in Rio Tinto
